translated: Ādyanātha, Anuttara-prakāśa-pañcāśikā

analyzed: om namaḥ nuttara prakāśa śaṅkarāya
translated: Om, salutations to the one who bestows the unsurpassed light of Śiva🔽The unfabricated self-awareness, the light that is one solid mass, is Śiva.

analyzed: śaktyā vimarśa vapuṣā sva ātmanaḥ
translated: By means of Śakti, which is of the same nature as his own Self, having the form of reflective awareness,

analyzed: śiva ādi kṣiti paryantam viśvam vapuḥ udañcayan
translated: Elevating the universe, from Śiva to the earth, as his own body,

original: pañcakṛtyamahānāṭya rasikaḥ krīḍati prabhuḥ // //🔽pṛthagartham arthavattā viśvaviśvaśarīrayoḥ /
analyzed: pṛthak artham arthavat tā viśva viśva śarīrayoḥ
translated: The Lord, who delights in the great drama of the five acts, plays.🔽The meaningfulness of the individual and the universe is the body of the universe.

analyzed: na viśva viśva vapuṣoḥ bhinna tā kā api tāttvikī
translated: There is no real difference between the universe and the body of the universe.

original: bhede sattāsphurattābhyāṃ bhinnaṃ kiṃ tu jagad bhavet /
analyzed: bhede sattā sphurat tābhyām bhinnam kim tu jagat bhavet
translated: If there were difference, the world would be different from existence and manifestation.

original: sattāsphurattāsaṃbandhāt sattābhānaṃ ca tan na cet // //
analyzed: sattā sphurat tā saṃbandhāt sattā bhānam ca tat na ced
translated: If the manifestation of existence is not due to the relation of existence and manifestation,

original: asataḥ kiṃ satas tābhyāṃ saṃbandhaḥ so 'yam iṣyate /🔽svarūpalābhasulabhaḥ saṃbandho na hy avastunaḥ // //
analyzed: asataḥ kim sataḥ tābhyām saṃbandhaḥ saḥ yam iṣyate  svarūpa lābha sulabhaḥ saṃbandhaḥ na hi avastunaḥ
translated: What relation is there between the non-existent and the existent? That is accepted.🔽The relation is easily obtained by the attainment of one's own nature, not by an unreal thing.

original: na labdharūpasaṃbandhe tābhyāṃ kiṃ cid upekṣyate /
analyzed: na labdha rūpa saṃbandhe tābhyām kim cit upekṣyate
translated: In the relation of the attained form, nothing is neglected by those two.

original: upekṣāyām avasthānaṃ na syād etasya kiṃ cana // //
analyzed: upekṣāyām avasthānam na syāt etasya kim cana
translated: If there is neglect, there would be no stability of this at all.

original: svabhāvataḥ sphurattā ca sattā ca na vināśinī /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ sphurat tā ca sattā ca na vināśinī
translated: The manifestation and existence of the nature [of consciousness] are indestructible.

analyzed: vināśa an abhupagame jaḍa tā api nivartate
translated: If destruction is not accepted, even the state of being inert is removed.

analyzed: tatas gati antara abhāvāt cit eva pariśiṣyate
translated: Therefore, only consciousness remains, due to the absence of any other alternative.

original: sataś cidaikyaṃ prakṛtaṃ kadā cin na nivartate // //🔽prakāśe 'nanyato bhāvaḥ svātantryollāsakevalaḥ /
analyzed: sataḥ cit aikyam prakṛtam kadā cit na nivartate  prakāśe bhāvaḥ svātantrya ullāsa kevalaḥ
translated: The oneness of the existent and consciousness, which is the original nature, never ceases at any time.🔽In light, existence is not from another, it is solely the manifestation of independence.

original: parichinnātmikā śaktiḥ śambhor viśvātiśāyinaḥ // //🔽yat prakāśātmakaṃ sarvaṃ tamaḥkevalatāṃ gatam /
analyzed: parichinna ātmikā śaktiḥ śambhoḥ viśva atiśāyinaḥ  yat prakāśa ātmakam sarvam tamaḥ kevala tām gatam
translated: The power that has a limited nature belongs to Śambhu, who transcends the universe.🔽Whatever is of the nature of light, having become solely darkness,

original: yac ca kiṃ cij jagad etat prakāśād atiricyate // //
analyzed: yat ca kim cit jagat etat prakāśāt atiricyate
translated: and whatever this universe is, it exceeds light.

original: vimṛśyasaraṇīṃ prāptam ity eṣā tāttvikī matiḥ /
analyzed: vimṛśya saraṇīm prāptam iti eṣā tāttvikī matiḥ
translated: This is the true opinion that it has reached the path of examination.

analyzed: avabhāsa eka tānānām matiḥ ekā atra sākṣiṇī
translated: The single consciousness of the various manifestations is the only witness here.

analyzed: kim varākaiḥ taiḥ cit anuprāṇita ātmabhiḥ
translated: What is the use of those poor means of knowledge, whose nature is sustained by consciousness?

original: na hi vaikartanaṃ jyotir dīpālokam apekṣate // //
analyzed: na hi vaikartanam jyotiḥ dīpa ālokam apekṣate
translated: The light of a lamp does not depend on the light of a candle.

analyzed: śaktipāta pavitre smin dhī tattve ca parīkṣyatām
translated: Let it be examined in this purified realm of thought by the descent of grace.

analyzed: ādarśa vimala ābhoge na tu sarvam prakāśate
translated: Not everything is manifested in the clear expanse of a mirror.

analyzed: ittham cit ātmakam sarvam ṣaṭtriṃśat bheda tattvataḥ
translated: Thus, everything is of the nature of consciousness, with thirty-six divisions of principles.

original: ādau śuddhātmakaṃ tattvaṃ pañcadhātamasaḥ param // //🔽śivaḥ śaktiś ca sādākhyam īśo vidyeti bhidyate /
analyzed: ādau śuddha ātmakam tattvam pañcadhā tamasaḥ param  śivaḥ śaktiḥ ca sādākhyam īśaḥ vidyā iti bhidyate
translated: In the beginning, the principle is of pure nature, beyond the five elements and darkness.🔽It is divided into Shiva, Shakti, Sadashiva, Isha, and Vidyā.

analyzed: akṣa ādi śānta varṇa ātmā niramāyi śivena tu
translated: The letters from A to Sha are created by Shiva.

analyzed: kalā vidyā rāga kāla niyatiḥ bandhaḥ ucyate
translated: Kalā, Vidyā, Rāga, Kāla, and Niyati are said to be the bonds.

analyzed: māyā pūrvaḥ vakāra ādi kṣakāra anta akṣara ātmakaḥ
translated: Māyā and the letters from Va to Ksha are of the nature of the letters from Va to Ksha.

original: pumāñ śaktir mano buddhir ahaṃkārādipañcakam /🔽śrotrādipañcakaṃ tādi ṭādi vāgādipañcakam // //
analyzed: śrotra ādi pañcakam tādi ṭādi vāc ādi pañcakam
translated: The Purusha, Shakti, Manas, Buddhi, and the group of five beginning with Ahamkāra,🔽The group of five beginning with Sha, the group of five beginning with Ta, and the group of five beginning with Va,
The group of five Tanmātras beginning with A, the group of five beginning with Ka, and the group of five beginning with Vyoman,

original: sisṛkṣoḥ prathamaspandaḥ śivatattvaṃ vibhoḥ smṛtam // //🔽icchaiva sāparimlānā śaktitattvam udañcayan /
analyzed: sisṛkṣoḥ prathama spandaḥ śivatattvam vibhoḥ smṛtam  icchā eva sā a parimlānā śakti tattvam udañcayan
translated: The first movement of the desire to create is remembered as the Shiva principle of the Lord.🔽That very desire, undiminished, raising the Shakti principle,

analyzed: sva icchayā a sūcitam viśvam ācchādya ahantayā sthitam
translated: Having covered the universe indicated by its own will, abides as the I-principle.

analyzed: saḥ eva tattvam sādākhyam sarva anugrahaṇa udyatam
translated: That very principle is called Sādākhya, ready to grace all.

original: sa eveśvaratattvaṃ syāt paśyan viśvam idantayā // //
analyzed: saḥ eva īśvara tattvam syāt paśyan viśvam idantayā
translated: That itself is the Īśvara principle, seeing the universe as this.
The unity of thisness and thatness is said to be knowledge.

analyzed: sva aṅga kalpeṣu bhāveṣu māyā tattvam vibheda dhīḥ
translated: The principle of māyā is the discriminating intellect in regard to entities that are like one's own limbs.

analyzed: māyā gṛhīta saṃkocaḥ śivaḥ puṃtattvam ucyate
translated: Śiva, who has contracted māyā, is said to be the principle of the individual soul.

original: ayam eva hi saṃsārī jīvo bhoktaiva dṛśyate // //
analyzed: ayam eva hi saṃsārī jīvaḥ bhoktā eva dṛśyate
translated: This very one is seen to be the transmigrating individual soul, the experiencer.

analyzed: jña tva kartṛ tva pūrṇa tva nitya tva anyasya śaktayaḥ
translated: Knowledge, action, fullness, and eternity are its powers.

original: tatsaṃkocāt saṃkucitaḥ kalādyātmatayā mataḥ // //🔽māyātmakaṃ kalā nāma kiṃcitkartṛtvakāraṇam /
analyzed: tad saṃkocāt saṃkucitaḥ kalā ādi ātma tayā mataḥ  māyā ātmakam kalā nāma kiṃcitkartṛtva kāraṇam
translated: Due to the contraction of that, it is considered to be contracted by the nature of kalā and so on.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.

original: kālaḥ paricchedakaro niyatiś cedam eva me // //🔽kartavyaṃ nānyad ity eṣā vyavasthā yantraṇākṛitiḥ /🔽prakṛtir guṇasāmyaṃ syād ahaṃkārādijanmabhūḥ // //
analyzed: kālaḥ pariccheda karaḥ niyatiḥ ca idam eva me  kartavyam na anyat iti eṣā vyavasthā yantraṇa ākṛitiḥ  prakṛtiḥ guṇa sāmyam syāt ahaṃkāra ādi janma bhūḥ
translated: Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.

original: ahaṃ mamedam ity etad buddhihetur ahaṃkṛtiḥ /
analyzed: aham mama idam iti etat buddhi hetuḥ ahaṃkṛtiḥ
translated: Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.

original: buddhir adhyavasāyasya kāraṇaṃ niścayātmanaḥ // //🔽saṃkalpasya vikalpasya bījaṃ mana udīryate /
analyzed: buddhiḥ adhyavasāyasya kāraṇam niścaya ātmanaḥ  saṃkalpasya vikalpasya bījam manaḥ udīryate
translated: Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.

analyzed: vacana ādeḥ ca śabda ādeḥ vāc ādi śravaṇa ādikam
translated: Kālāgni Rudra is the cause of the contraction of the individual soul.🔽Kālāgni Rudra is

analyzed: kāraṇam śravaṇa ādīnām grāhyam tanmātra pañcakam
translated: The group of five tanmatras (subtle elements) is the cause of hearing etc. and is to be grasped.

analyzed: ākāśa ādi avakāśa ādi kāraṇam bhūta pañcakam
translated: The group of five elements is the cause of space etc. and is the cause of the group of five tanmatras.
The group of five, beginning with Vidyā (knowledge), is in the pure (element) consisting of the powers of the higher and lower (i.e. Śiva and Śakti).

original: tadanyad aparāśaktir ity etat tattvam īritam // //
analyzed: tad anyat aparā śaktiḥ iti etat tattvam īritam
translated: The other (element) is the power of the lower (i.e. Prakṛti). This is said to be the truth.

analyzed: iyam devī parā śaktiḥ śuddha aśuddha adhva garbhiṇī
translated: This Goddess is the supreme power, containing the pure and impure paths.

original: pṛthivyādīni tattvāni yadālīnāni kāraṇe // //🔽tadā kāraṇamātrāṇi bahir udvamate vibhuḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī ādīni tattvāni yad ālīnāni kāraṇe  tadā kāraṇa mātrāṇi bahis udvamate vibhuḥ
translated: The principles beginning with Earth, which are dependent on the cause,🔽then the all-pervading one emits externally the mere causes.

analyzed: anuttara icche unmeṣe ānanda īśanam ūna tā
translated: In the will of the Absolute, in the unfolding, there is the deficiency of the bliss of the essence.

analyzed: kriyā icchā jñāna śaktīnām sattā ṣaṣ
translated: The existence of the powers of action, will, and knowledge is six.

analyzed: icchā īśana antara ārūḍhā sphuṭa asphuṭa jagat mayī
translated: Embodied in the will and the desire, she is the manifest and unmanifest universe.

analyzed: anuttarā ityādi tri padyeṣu artha asaṃgatyā pāṭha aśuddhiḥ pratibhāti
translated: In the three verses beginning with in the will of the Absolute, the purity of the text seems to be due to the lack of coherence in the meaning.

analyzed: catvāraḥ paratas varṇāḥ ṣaṇḍa ātmānaḥ pracoditāḥ
translated: Four letters are impelled from the supreme, having the nature of a group.
The power of bliss of the Absolute, from the triangle, by the yoga of the circle.

analyzed: tathā evā ūna iṣa yogena kriyāśakteḥ sphuṭam vapuḥ
translated: In the same way, by the yoga of unfolding, the manifest body of the power of action.

analyzed: uktam tri śakti saṃghaṭṭāt triśūlam dvaita ghasmaram
translated: It is said that from the union of the three powers, the trident devours duality.

analyzed: paraspara virodhe tu kāryeṣu pravirohati
translated: But when there is mutual contradiction in the effects, it grows.

original: na kathaṃcid upādeyam āsāṃ rūpam idaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: na kathaṃcid upādeyam āsām rūpam idam bhavet
translated: This form of theirs could never be accepted in any way.

original: bindur vedyasya saṃskāro vimarśaḥ sarga ity asau /
analyzed: binduḥ vedyasya saṃskāraḥ vimarśaḥ sargaḥ iti asau
translated: The dot is the purification of the knowable, the reflection is the creation, it is

analyzed: kalā ṣoḍaśaka ākārā śaktiḥ vijayate parā
translated: The power of sixteen parts, the supreme, triumphs.

analyzed: tithayaḥ pratipad pūrvāḥ pañcadaśa iti māyayā
translated: The lunar days beginning with the first, up to the fifteenth, by the power of illusion,

analyzed: sūryācandramasau sva antar carantau sthiti hetave
translated: The sun and moon moving within, are the cause of persistence.

analyzed: yathā vimarśa vapuṣaḥ sargasya ādyāḥ kalāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The primordial parts of creation, which have the nature of reflection, are remembered.

analyzed: dvidhā iyam mātṛkā devī bīja yoni ātmanā sthitā
translated: The two-fold goddess Matrka abides in the form of seed and womb.

analyzed: nitya pravṛtta śṛṅgāṭa vapuḥ viśvasya janma bhūḥ
translated: The eternal, ever-present, universal body, the source of the world's birth,

original: hṛdayaṃ bījam etasyāṃ sāraṃ yat tat paraṃ mahaḥ // //
analyzed: hṛdayam bījam etasyām sāram yat tat param mahaḥ
translated: The heart, the seed, is in this, the supreme essence, the great splendor.

original: vaṭabīje yathā vṛkṣas tathātra nihitaṃ jagat /
analyzed: vaṭa bīje yathā vṛkṣaḥ tathā atra nihitam jagat
translated: Just as the tree is in the banyan seed, so the world is contained here.

analyzed: vicāryamāṇe na eva idam kāraṇāt atiricyate
translated: When examined, this does not go beyond the cause.

analyzed: mṛd ādeḥ kalaśa ādīnām tattvam na anyat nirūpaṇe
translated: The reality of the pot and so on is not different from clay when analyzed.

original: ity āhus tattvavādinyaḥ śrutīnām antimā giraḥ // //
analyzed: iti āhuḥ tattva vādinyaḥ śrutīnām antimāḥ giraḥ
translated: Thus speak the final words of the Vedas, the proponents of truth.

original: idaṃ sarvaṃ sad evāsīd agre iti viniścayāt /
analyzed: idam sarvam sat eva āsīt agre iti viniścayāt
translated: Having ascertained that in the beginning this entire universe was existent only,

original: sattāvācini bīje 'smin bhāti māyā tv idaṃ jagat // //
analyzed: sattā vācini bīje smin bhāti māyā tu idam jagat
translated: in this seed expressing existence, this universe is manifested by Maya.

analyzed: vilupta pratyaya ākāram etat sa pariśiṣyate
translated: This alone remains, devoid of the form of conceptualization.

analyzed: tatas jñāna kriyā sāra vidyeśvara sadāśivāḥ
translated: Then the Vidyasesa Sadasiva, the essence of knowledge and action,

original: śaktitriśūle līyante caturdaśakalātmani /🔽ūrdhvādhaḥ sṛṣṭivapuṣi sarvaṃ līnam ataḥ param // //
analyzed: śakti triśūle līyante caturdaśa kalā ātmani  ūrdhva adhas sṛṣṭi vapuṣi sarvam līnam atas param
translated: dissolves in the trident of Shakti, consisting of the fourteen digits.🔽Above and below, in the body of creation, everything is dissolved beyond this.

original: itthaṃ parasyāṃ saṃvittau sarvaṃ saṃkucitaṃ kramāt /
analyzed: ittham parasyām saṃvittau sarvam saṃkucitam kramāt
translated: Thus, everything is gradually contracted in the supreme consciousness.

analyzed: athavā manasā atīte yatra kvāpi nirañjane
translated: Or, in some pure place beyond the mind,
in the thirty-six tattvas, the waves of which are beyond quarrel,

analyzed: viśvātmani mahā mantre svabhāve sā vilīyate
translated: in the great mantra of the universal Self, that (consciousness) dissolves in its own nature.

original: kṛtaś cainmathite dhāmni dīpte kenāpi hetunā /
analyzed: kṛtaḥ ca ed mathite dhāmni dīpte kena api hetunā
translated: And when the abode is churned and heated by someone for some reason,

original: sarvaṃ havir idaṃ juhvan na dāridryeṇa pīḍyate // //
analyzed: sarvam haviḥ idam juhvan na dāridryeṇa pīḍyate
translated: offering everything as oblation, one is not afflicted by poverty.

analyzed: pañca pañca ātmakam viśvam pañca spanda vijṛmbhitam
translated: The universe is fivefold, manifesting through the five pulsations,

analyzed: saṃkocayat parāmarśāt sāmānya spanda kevalam
translated: From the contracted reflective awareness, there is only the vibration of the universal.

analyzed: pralayam kurvan idamaḥ pratiyoginaḥ
translated: Destroying the 'I' and the 'this', the opponent,

analyzed: parākrama paraḥ bhuṅkte svabhāvam aśiva apaham
translated: Devoted to valor, it enjoys its own nature, which removes the inauspicious.

analyzed: iti ṣaṣ adhika triṃśat bheda prasakta jagat tanuḥ prasarati mahā śakti ullekha vicitra mahā paṭī
translated: Thus, the body of the universe, connected with thirty-six divisions, spreads out, the great curtain of the wonderful manifestation of the great power.

original: jayati bahuśaḥ spandākārā parā cid anuttarā vimṛśata janāḥ kiṃ no svabhāvavijṛmbhitam // //
analyzed: jayati bahuśas spanda ākārā parā cit anuttarā vimṛśata janāḥ kim no svabhāva vijṛmbhitam
translated: The supreme consciousness, in the form of vibration, is victorious many times. O people, contemplate! Is it not the manifestation of our own nature?

original: iti śrīmadādyanāthaviracitā anuttaraprakāśapañcāśikā samāptā🔽seyaṃ kāśmīrabhūpāla saṃśritena prakāśitā /
analyzed: iti śrīmat ādyanātha viracitā anuttara prakāśa pañcāśikā samāptā  sā iyam kāśmīra bhūpāla saṃśritena prakāśitā
translated: Thus ends the fifty verses on the illumination of the Absolute, composed by the venerable Ādinātha.🔽This has been revealed by the virtuous Mukundarāma, who has taken refuge in the king of Kashmir.

analyzed: satā mukundarāmeṇa sat mude stu śive rpitā
translated: May it be dedicated to Śiva for the delight of the good.
